name: Smoked Trout and Egg Scramble
description: Smoked fish is a popular ingredient throughout Britain.  You can find dishes containing it gracing tables at any hour of the day, but the delicate flavor of smoked trout is most often found paired with eggs as a light meal in the morning or early afternoon.
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons butter, plus more for toast
8 ounces smoked trout or salmon, skin removed and meat flaked into bite-sized pieces
Kosher salt and cracked black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Combine eggs and milk in a large bowl. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium low heat; when butter has melted, add eggs and cook stirring often with a spatula.
Once eggs begin to thicken and come away from the pan, add smoked trout and gently incorporate into eggs. When eggs are still very soft, remove from heat and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Place each piece of toast on a plate then divide eggs over the toast; top with sliced scallions and serve immediately.
